required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sperm DNA Fragmentation Effects on Blastocyst Morphology Grading, Pregnancy Rate and Implantation Rate
clinical_study.official_title: The Correlation of Sperm DNA Fragmentation With Blastocyst Grading and Its Implantation Potential

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective cohort study for 189 couples assigned to normal and abnormal Sperm DNA fragmentation (SDF) groups.To determine the effect of SDF on blastocyst's trophectoderm (TE), Inner cell mass (ICM) morphology grading, and implantation rate. Semen in both groups was processed by density gradient (DG).

detailed_description.textblock:
Purpose: to determine if sperm DNA fragmentation (SDF) has a correlation with Blastocyst's trophectoderm (TE) and Inner cell mass (ICM) grading, or with the implantation rate?
Method: Retrospective cohort study for 189 couples, assigned to normal SDF group (121 cases), and abnormal SDF group (68 cases). Semen in both groups was processed by double layer density gradient (DG).
Statistical analysis done using SPSS version 22.

primary_outcome.description: Morphological grading of trophectoderm and Inner cell mass using Gardner's criteria 1999, from grade A to C ( A is the highest quality).
Percentage of the implanted embryos number for each group / number of transferred embryos.

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of fertilized oocyte (appearance of two pronuclei) / Number of injected oocytes
Percentage of pregnant cases / transferred cases for each group ( positive pregnancy test)

arm_group.description: Couples with male partners having SDF lower than 20% using TUNEL assay
Couples with male partners having SDF greater than 20% using TUNEL assay

intervention.description: Intracytoplasmic sperm injection of female partner oocytes with ejaculated sperm selected by density gradient centrifugation

study_pop.textblock: ICSI patients in Ganin Fertility Center from January 2018 to September 2018.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All cases in this study have to reach the blastocyst stage.
- Female age ≤37 years old.
- Male sperm count ≥ 5 million.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Usage of sperm selection techniques.
- Testicular aspiration or testicular biopsies.
- Oocyte or sperm donation.

eligibility.gender_description: female age ≤37 years old, with no limitation on male age

reference.citation: Wdowiak A, Bojar I. Relationship between pregnancy, embryo development, and sperm deoxyribonucleic acid fragmentation dynamics. Saudi J Biol Sci. 2016 Sep;23(5):598-606. doi: 10.1016/j.sjbs.2015.08.001. Epub 2015 Aug 10.

Gat I, Tang K, Quach K, Kuznyetsov V, Antes R, Filice M, Zohni K, Librach C. Sperm DNA fragmentation index does not correlate with blastocyst aneuploidy or morphological grading. PLoS One. 2017 Jun 7;12(6):e0179002. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0179002. eCollection 2017.

Alvarez Sedó C, Bilinski M, Lorenzi D, Uriondo H, Noblía F, Longobucco V, Lagar EV, Nodar F. Effect of sperm DNA fragmentation on embryo development: clinical and biological aspects. JBRA Assist Reprod. 2017 Dec 1;21(4):343-350. doi: 10.5935/1518-0557.20170061.
